intro: Dissotidendron caloneurum var. setosius, commonly known as the hairy dissotidendron, is a unique member of the Rutaceae family. It is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and distinctive, glandular-hairy foliage. The leaves are typically opposite, with a rough texture and a strong aromatic scent. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
